abstract.p: Mitsubishi Corp will team up with Japan's Softbank to form company called Eupholink Inc, to offer advisory services and capital to feldgling and established companies that are seeking to do more business online (S)

block.p: Mitsubishi, perhaps the bluest of Japan's blue-chip companies, said it would team up with Softbank, the country's leading Internet investment company, to form a company called Eupholink Inc. to offer advisory services and capital to fledgling and established companies alike that are seeking to do more business online. Mitsubishi will hold a 49 percent stake in the company, which will have initial capitalization of 490 million yen, or about $4.5 million, and two Softbank subsidiaries will own the rest.

Mitsubishi, perhaps the bluest of Japan's blue-chip companies, said it would team up with Softbank, the country's leading Internet investment company, to form a company called Eupholink Inc. to offer advisory services and capital to fledgling and established companies alike that are seeking to do more business online. Mitsubishi will hold a 49 percent stake in the company, which will have initial capitalization of 490 million yen, or about $4.5 million, and two Softbank subsidiaries will own the rest.
